desc: Im needing a experienced animator for a project called Howl. Heres a small description about Howl. Centuries ago wolves lived together in peace. Prey was plentiful, predators never appeared, everyone got along well, and everything seemed just about perfect. Then, one day, a war broke out. The war went on for what seemed to be years. Sorrow, hate, anger, so many emotions were freed. Finally, when the war came to an end, the wolves of the forest split into six different packs based off their own mythical capabilities. The Pack of Thundering Paws, The Pack of Clamping Jaws, The Pack of Shimmering Moon, The Pack of Blazing Fire, and lastly, The Pack of Roaring Rivers. Territories were made and wolves were torn. Prey started becoming harder to find, and predators were everywhere. Things only continued to get worse, the fights. The fights were constant, wolves always fought, always injured or even died. Everything was completely switched around. It was the start of an agonized way of life. Even now the packs still remain enemies. Whirling around, scared someone's behind you, ready to snap your neck, wasn't a normal way to live. The Gods of the Skies have been sending out wolves from each pack to climb to the dangerous Fang Mountain. Legends say that the mountain holds great power, power that belongs to only wolves who truly deserve it. Wolves who will use it to end this misery and pain. But, every time someone attempted to climb the mountain, they were never seen of again. This system has been going on ever since wolves were split into packs. Not even one wolf has ever came back alive. Now that your a little informed, ill be needing an animator for this project. This will be a continuing series, meaning this will continue going on in episodes. I will be paying the animator and I expect 2d animation for this project. This animation will be hosted on youtube, the animator will be credited for all art and animation. The type of animals that will need to be animated will be wolves, dogs, elk, beavers, deer, fish, birds, ect. The type of environment, a forest filled with trees, leaves, lakes, stones, dens, underground dens, ect. I am an artist myself, so ill be glad to sketch out what some of the dens look like. (Most of them are rocky and clay looking) If you would like to animate in this project, please contact my email at poppyandme9@[url removed, login to view] or at my discord, RainbowNerds#8770 If your needing any more information on this project, then ill be glad to answer any questions you have.
title: Howl (Animation Project)

desc: i am working in a RPG game that is based on theories related to quantum physics and space/time travels,  that require realistic "futuristic"/"space armored"  humans as (Halo or similars) characters but in the head just with some kind of googles/othersi will need a 2d/3d character creator/animator, to create the 2d sprites for my project,i will start with the demo, so i just need one character with basic movements, then after my project is approve, i will need the same animator to generate 20 to 30 additional characters/enemies.requirements..+character type: similar to armor as Halo/Raiden from Metal gear (i personally don't like Halo suits for this game so try something not so Halo)+perspective: sprites to be similar angle to RPG 2d games as old Final fantasy+2 to 6 frames per animation:- 1 x static, 1 x running, 2 x attacking (using a illuminated blade gun or similars), 1 x receiving a hit, 1 x dead and 1 x blocking- size, between 100 to 150 pixels height     (human must fit in this height)- width depending on the type of animation- and maybe capability to export some time the same version at 300 pixel heightNote: i am looking for a draft version of the character with not so much details and low resolutions textures (if is a 3d model), that may require extra hours to get final version of this model.finally: it will be necessary at some point provide the quote for the additional 20 to 30 characters/equipment/items that will be required later.Note: make sure that experience with 2d games are necessary as i am not looking for a extreme detailed 3d character that i will dream with use it but then when exported to a 2d in the 100 -150 pixel resolutions it will looks like a blurred object without details
title: 2d animations sprites for a RPG game
